title: 13.3 Insertion
content:
Section 13.3

Insertion

Summary

Insert like BST, color red, then fix violations with rotations.

Key Points

  • Insert as in regular BST, color new node RED
  • May violate: root is black, or red-red parent-child
  • Six cases (symmetric pairs) handled by rotations and recoloring
  • Key insight: push violations up the tree toward root
  • At most O(log n) time, at most 2 rotations

Example

Insert creates red node. If parent is red, uncle determines which case. Recolor and/or rotate.

Why It Matters

Maintains balance automatically during insertions.
